current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish pilot projects under the
		  Medicare program to provide incentives for home health agencies to furnish
		  remote patient monitoring services that reduce expenditures under such
		  program.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Fostering Independence Through
			 Technology Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: makes the following findings:

text.#text:
Allowing seniors
			 to remain in their homes longer can delay unnecessary, costly transfers to
			 higher acuity care settings.

Remote patient
			 monitoring provides opportunities to control chronic conditions and research
			 shows that approximately 66 percent of total health care spending is associated
			 with care for the over one-in-four Americans with multiple chronic
			 conditions.

Current remote
			 patient monitoring programs report patient satisfaction rates of over 90
			 percent.

Due to changes
			 enacted by Congress, hospitals are facing payment penalties for patients that
			 are readmitted to the hospital within 30 days of discharge.

Current remote
			 patient monitoring programs that use technology to monitor discharged patients
			 in non-invasive ways have experienced a reduction in hospital
			 readmissions.

header.#text:
Remote patient monitoring and support pilot
			 projects

for the purpose of

			 monitoring services that reduce expenditures under such title.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: title XVIII of the Social Security Act

Not later than 9 months after the date of
			 the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct the pilot
			 projects under this section in both urban and rural areas.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct at least 1 of
			 the pilot projects in a State with a population of less than 1,000,000.

			 assessment, treatment, and any additional services that utilize technologies
			 specified by the
